title: Drawing, Design  for Oak Round Table and Chair, 1900–05
title_raw: Design  for Oak Round Table and Chair
medium: Graphite ochre color pencil on thin, cream tracing paper
inscribed: In graphite, at lower center of sheet: "Oak Table 4'-6" diameter/to extend to 8'-0". . ."
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Round molded taqble raised on column-like support sitting on molded octagonal base with four splayed legs with brass feet on casters.  To the right of the table design, a chair with a trapezoidal seat and a vase splat has straight side rails extending into raked back legs; front legs are straight.  On the sides, legs are joined by stretchers; a single stretcher attaches horizontally across center.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design  for Oak Round Table and Chair, 1900–05. Graphite ochre color pencil on thin, cream tracing paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-99
